demand-side platforms supply-side platforms ad exchanges and various other ad networks and different ad systems
between when a viewer makes a request for an ad and when the viewer finally sees that ad in addition to that the ad
that's returned from the ad server could frequently be formatted in a different way than what the content is formatted
in so that's why as a customer as an N viewer you frequently see a jarring

and more disjointed user experience and well that ultimately translates to is

those video segments can be either a Content segment or an ad segment but in

between aspect ratio and resolution changes and finally being able to
accurately report on ad metrics that is being played back by your clients so of

ad insertion you are relying essentially on distributed clients to scale out ad

spec calls for a new what's called a tag called discontinuity tags and these
discontinuity tags essentially indicate when content transitions one segment of
video is different from another segment of video so in this world the segment
that's a Content segment is different from the ad segment that's going to come up next so just to crystallize that this is what
a typical HLS manifest looks like without ads just say you know you're
watching content from some live streaming or video on-demand streaming
service you have individual segments that are four seconds long which is what the in 4.0 means
so from CloudFront as you player plays through those segments it downloads them
and renders them the player now if you insert ads you have the first segment
that's three seconds long there is a splice point where there's an insertion
at that point we create a discontinuity marker and now that we have 12 seconds
and change worth of ads in the next few segments before finally you know
creating another splice point and then returning back to content so at its core
what server-side ad insertion is is manipulating this manifest file this is the HLS manifest file and that includes
content and add segments and that's
really one of the motivations for why we built out media Taylor it's really our
mission is to allow customers to be able to more effectively monetize their video
